doc.title: Bank of Queensland
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Bank of Queensland Work in progressBank of Queensland Work in progress_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: UNDERPERFORM | PO: 5.90 AUD | Price: 7.27 AUD
·Pre-release: FY25 Cash NPAT $375-385m, 2H25 $192-202m, vs cons. $195m
·FY26E 8% ROE target abandoned; exploring equip. finance sale
·Reiterate Underperform. PO lowered to A$5.90 with EPS cut 4% on average

BOQ pre-released FY25E Cash NPAT of $375-385m (2H25: $192-202m, up 5-10% H/H). Guidance was below BofA 2H25E at $209m and in-line with consensus at $195m. We cut our Cash EPS estimates by 4% on average with higher costs. In addition, FY25 non-cash items totalled $82m, a c.17bp drag on the CET1 ratio in 2H25. We forecast 2H25 CET1 at 10.68%, vs 10.25-10.75% target, whilst peers remain above their targets.

Targets for FY26E CTI of 56% and ROE 8% have been abandoned, as broadly expected. Management cited a "highly unpredictable operating environment" and "accelerating industry headwinds". FY25 ROE improved by 50-70bp, however we expect returns to stagnate in FY26E at 6.4% (flat on FY25) excluding benefits from potential asset sales.

BOQ announced a potential whole-of-loan sale process for up to c.$3.8bn of equipment finance loans. The economics of a deal (if any) remain subject to agreed price and servicing fees; BOQ expects any deal would be ROE and EPS accretive with a shift in the mix to capital light earnings.

Reiterate U/P. Low returns warrant discounted valuations, in our view. We cut our PO to A$5.90 (down 2% from A$6.00), implies 0.7x price-to-tangible book for a forecast c.7.5% ROE (ex. goodwill). BOQ trades on 13.0x consensus P/E (11.9x 10-year avg.), a 14% P/E discount to BEN (3% 10-year avg. discount) and 51% discount to the ASX200 ex Banks.

One of the three listed Australian regional banks, Bank of Queensland Ltd (BOQ) is based in Queensland and expanding inter-state through the mortgage broker channel and its owner-manager branch franchise model. The bank provides banking services to retail and small- to medium- sized businesses.
Our Underperform rating reflects revenue challenges, lagging volume growth, normalising bad debts and below- the- line items impacting capital generation.

BOQ guided to FY25E Cash NPAT of \(\)375-385\(m which implies\)\uparrow 25\(Cash NPAT of\)\uparrow 192-202m up 5-10\% H/H. Guidance was below our 2H25 estimate of\)\uparrow 209m\(and in-line with consensus at\)\uparrow 195m.
Changes to our earnings estimates are driven by:
- Higher expectations for costs and lower net interest income; based on pre-released Cash NPAT below BofA estimates and peer results in the June quarter.
- Non-cash items totalling \(\)82m\(announced including branch strategy costs, restructuring costs and an increase in the provision related to AUSTRAC remediation.**
Changes to our earnings estimates
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 2: BOQ noted FY25E ROE improved by 50-70bp
Key financial and operating metrics
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 3: P/E at 13.0x is above the long-run average of 11.9x BOQ 1-year Forward P/E
Source: BofA Global Research, Bloomberg
Exhibit 4: P/E reflects a \(51\%\) discount to the market BOQ P/E relative to the ASX 200 ex banks index
Source: BofA Global Research, Bloomberg
Exhibit 5: 0.8x P/B vs 10-year average 0.93x BOQ price-to-book multiple
Source: BofA Global Research, Bloomberg
Exhibit 6: Dividend yield of \(5.1\%\) is 1 s.d. below average BOQ 1-year Forward Dividend Yield
Source: BofA Global Research, Bloomberg
Exhibit 7: BOQ P/OPP at 8.2x, above the 10 year average at 7.1x BOQ price to pre-provision profit multiple
Source: BofA Global Research, Bloomberg
Exhibit 8: BOQ trading at a \(14\%\) discount to BEN BOQ 1-year Forward P/E relative to BEN
Source: BofA Global Research, Bloomberg

Our BOQ price objective of A\\$5.90 is based on a Gordon Growth- derived target P/B multiple. We adjust BVPS to exclude goodwill and derive a target P/B multiple of 0.7x based on a combination of near- term modelled ROE (ex- goodwill) and a long- run (marginal ROE) assumption. In the case of BOQ, we assume a long- run ROE of 7.5%. The other key fundamental assumptions used in our valuation include, but are not limited to, a 4.5% long- run risk free rate, a 5.5% equity risk premium and a terminal growth rate of 3.0% together with an assumed beta of 1.1x.

Downside risks: Elevated competition in mortgage and deposit markets disproportionately impact BOQ vs competitors. Risk the benefits of cost simplification are not achieved given inflationary pressures. Upside risks: Improvement in loan growth. Delivery of FY26 targets.
All banks are subject to macroeconomic conditions, which impact credit growth, interest margins and credit losses.

The date and time of completion of the production of any recommendation in this report shall be the date and time of dissemination of this report as recorded in the report timestamp.
